text.p: These are the main stories in Latvian newspapers on Friday. Prepared for Reuters by the Co-operation Fund. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
ALL NEWSPAPERS
- Welfare minister Vladimirs Makarovs survived a no-confidence vote in parliament.

- Draft amendments to the election law were submitted to committees at the parliament's session. The amendments envisage tougher rules for the creation of political parties and provide for recalling of MP's.

- On April 23 Prime Minister Andris Shkele visited the eastern border to evaluate the situation there. He concluded that reconstruction of the eastern border should be started this year. To this end, the government plans to take a $30 million loan.
- Finance minister Roberts Zile announced at a press conference that in March Latvia witnessed a substantial growth in economic activities. The economic activity index was 4.7.

- The Ministry of Finance is planning to issue five-year state bonds. It's likely to happen until the end of the year. At present the value of T-bills in circulation is 150 million lats. The ministry will seek to minimize the number of short-term bills and to replace them with long-term ones.
DIENA
- The minister of culture, Rihards Piks, and the director of the National opera Andrejs Zagars reached an agreement with the opera trade union that the salaries of opera personnel would be increased.
- Parliament passed the law on practising physicians.
- The Bank of Latvia announced its decision to cut its refinancing rate to four percent from five percent.
BIZNES & BALTIJA
- The second international ballet festival opened today in Riga.

- After investing $2 million in the reconstruction of the department store Dole, Varner opens its first supermarket in Riga. The supermarket was opened by Knut Toraudsen, Norwegian ambassador to Latvia.
- The Baltic Russians gather for a conference in Jurmala to discuss educational problems.
- Latvia Tours have signed a contract with American Express to become the distributor of AE's traveller's cheques in Latvia.
SM
- Four tank wagons full of diesel oil ran off the rails near Sarkandaugava railway station in Riga. No diesel oil was spilt.
DIENAS BIZNESS
- The state revenue service needs an additional 10.3 million lats from this year's state budget to improve tax collection, said the director general of the service, Andrejs Sonchiks.

- The Latvian Association of commercial banks reported that the total assets of Latvia's commercial banks increased by 24 million lats to 1.15 billion lats in the first three months of this year. The capital stock of the banks fell 4.3 million lats. Deposits rose by 20.6 million to 779 million lats. The total of credits issued by the banks dropped by 9.6 million lats to 301 million lats (three percent).
